summary: For certain architecture and engineering services, the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers often uses multiple-award contracts. These are awarded to a group of contractors, who are deemed "prequalified" for projects within the scope of the initial award. In 2020, the Corps issued a policy outlining the process for choosing the most qualified contractor from the prequalified group for a project. But industry raised concerns about...
title: Army Corps of Engineers: Data Needed to Monitor Implementation of Revised Policy for Selecting Architecture and Engineering Contractors
